It turns out there are two

guy goes to a bank login page,

enters your user ID, and
starts guessing passwords. That's about all an attacker who
gets just your bookmarks can do.

They know where
you log in and what your user ID is but no clue
about your site or master

passwords. This attack is slow, and
it's easily detected. So we don't have to

Offline attacks
are more serious. So if the attacker steals

stores the hashes of users
passwords and starts guessing, that can be fast

but you can mitigate it with

would take three days to

it would take almost a year to
